review_title: great place to work- like family
pros: close commute and flexible and nice co- workers
cons: it is closing and we can no longer work there

pros: Great emergency room employees, emergency room has techs that draw all the patient blood for the nurses. There are a few people that have worked here a long time. Registration in emergency room have all new employees and they do a good job.
cons: Lots of psych patients sent to the emergency room due to psych hospital. Short staffed for all shifts. All the managers and directors quit since the beginning of the year. Upstairs, staffing is bad too. Long waits to get patients to the beds because there are never enough staff. Vacations are never approved and it’s dangerous working conditions. Not enough PCAs or security guards. Our nurse managers and directors all quit. No one stays anymore because we are afraid to lose our license. Lots of 1 on 1s

review_title: Get Your Experience and Get Out
pros: Nursing directors work long hours and are usually available but no one is present on the weekends. The lab and radiology staff are nice. The drs are nice and feel bad for the nurses. We got free food from the community for COVID. The security guards help with difficult patients.
cons: Bad staffing, poor morale, no one stays so you are constantly training new nurses. There is no CNAs and there is no phlebotomists at night or weekends. The nursing supervisors are supportive but we never see leadership except for our unit director. All our managers quit the last couple of months. Oh and the showers were turned off for months and we couldn’t shower patients. No one knows who is in charge for months. We don’t have enough stuff because it was moved to the COVID unit.

review_title: Unsafest Hospital I've Ever Encountered Especially With Covid-19
job_title: RN Behavioral Health in Coatesville, PA
cons: Behavioral Health is a joke. There has been no manager for YEARS. Despite what the hospital says, HOUSEKEEPING IS RARE/NON-EXISTENT. Psych units are filthy. Broken, out dated equipment. Their staff COVID "screening" consists of a SECURIT GUARD who takes your temp. with A BROKEN THEMOMETER!!! They have a COVID unit that is NEVER CLEANED and ALWAYS SHORT STAFFED putting staff and patients at risk. Many times there is ONE RN for up to 15 patients on a unit with only ONE TECH--INCLUDING THE COVID UNIT WHICH ONLY SEPARATES OTHER PATIENTS BY A DOOR!!! There have been COVID outbreaks on the various units BECAUSE COVID POS PATIENTS ARE BEING SENT TO THE FLOORS WITHOUT TESTING!!! Intake is always pushing the units to take inappropriate patients with known history of violence against staff or homeless COVID patients to fill the beds for $$$$. Someone needs to do an ethics investigation! NO SUPPLIES for WOUND CARE PATIENTS ON THE FLOORS!!!

review_title: Good experience for Psych but low pay
job_title: Mental Health Technician in Coatesville, PA
pros: Nee managers in the BHP remain positve even with an unknown future. The people that stay are like family. You get to care for your home town. You learn a lot because it’s a real psych hospital. The psych nurses and therapists are dedicated. New drs are pretty good too
cons: Not enough staff. Staff always leaving. No one really in charge just a lot of new managwrs all the time. The pay is too low. I’ve had four different managers in one year.

pros: Friendly environment everyone is helping each other
cons: Fair that it is going to be closed and lot of people will be jobless. Very short staff

pros: great staff, great benefits, good management
Working nights (away from management), nice coworkers, good commute. I felt like Janet Newcomb cared about staff input.
cons: Severely understaffed, low salary, high staff turnover, clueless and incompetent management. The hospital town hall meetings often stressed getting people in for elective procedures to make more money.

job_title: Critical Care RN in West Chester, PA
pros: The people (patients, and some co-workers) are amazing
cons: ALWAYS UNDER-STAFFED, very, very,  very bad nurse to Patients ratio (on critical care/cardiac care floors) I have had as many as 7 patients at one time, young nurses who don't have very much experience in charge of floors/ hospital. Hospital Administrators promote people if they like them, if they are pretty, regardless of experience.

review_title: You can do better and you deserve better.
pros: A job as a nurse in a community hospital
cons: There are really just too many negatives: poor management, low wages, bad reputation, nobody takes responsibility, nobody cares.

pros: People that work there and have been there for a while genuinely care about the hospital and the patients.
cons: Management gives no thought to nurses and aides with their actions. Short-staffed constantly creating unsafe conditions. Salary and benefits nowhere near competitive with other local hospitals in the area. As a for-profit hospital it is all about the money, not about the patient care and caring for the employees. Things will hopefully get better as Reading Health takes over, but that may take a while to see changes.

review_title: Some of the Best Employees I Ever Worked With
pros: Their new CEO, HR Director and CNO are engaged. The CFO is often found rounding through the hospital and checking on staff. There has been a lot of leadership turnover but it’s for the better. The employees truly care about the community.
cons: The hospital still needs some updating as much of the interior is out of date. Many of our nurses leave after obtaining their BSNs to work in larger or city hospitals.

review_title: Slowly worsening with staff that cares
pros: Direct management is great! Understanding, genuinely cares
cons: Higher management or administration does not care forces high patient ratios with inadequate staffing
Struggling hospital overall as history and brand identity is negative in the local community.
